channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Disney’s streaming strategy gets more confusing as Venu Sports venture is axed
item.description: Analysts are split on whether Disney should move forward with plans to combine Hulu + Live TV and Fubo, following the cancellation of its sports joint...

item.title: Judge Rules American Airlines Violated Retirement-Plan Duties by Encouraging ESG Investing
item.description: The company’s 401(k) plan was found to favor socially conscious goals over financial returns.

item.title: The stock market has one more chance to fight off the bears
item.description: Another S&P 500 close below 5,870 would signal more downside for the index. Plus, Amazon looks weak.

item.title: Do you still have to pay your mortgage if your house burns down? Some multimillion-dollar homes may not qualify for disaster relief.
item.description: The multimillion-dollar homes burning in the L.A. wildfires may not qualify for mortgage relief.

item.title: SEC, Shift4 Payments Reach Disclosure-Violation Settlement
item.description: The Securities and Exchange Commission reached a $750,000 settlement with Shift4 Payments, resolving allegations that the payments-technology company ...

item.title: U.S. Stock Indexes Slide, Bond Yields Jump After Jobs Report
item.description: Stock indexes fell, with the S&P 500 wiping out its 2025 gains, as investors assessed a blockbuster jobs report that makes future interest-rate cuts s...

item.title: Here’s when you can file your 2024 taxes — and what’s new this year with refunds, tax laws and free tax prep
item.description: Income-tax refunds averaged more than $3,100 last year. How much will they be this year?

item.title: Constellation Energy Agrees to Buy Calpine for $16.4 Billion
item.description: The merger combines two of the country’s largest power generators as demand for electricity surges.

item.title: Dow sees worst start to a year since 2016 as Fed rate-cut hopes fade for 2025
item.description: U.S. stocks are down so far in 2025 as market volatility climbs.

item.title: Founder of Private-Equity Firm Backed by Wealthy Families Settles With SEC
item.description: Hendrik Jordaan agreed to pay a $250,000 civil penalty but didn’t admit or deny the regulator’s findings.
